fields.summary: DNS search path in CC does not update with CLC property

comments.body: EUCA-4226 was a feature request mentioning support for this.

[~sjones], [~kedwards].  I just talked to [~viglesias] on this issue.  
A fix that involves a propagation of a property from the CLC to the CC will likely be too onerous for 3.4.  Instead, that fix should be considered for 4.0.  

As an interim fix, it would be acceptable to have a new property created on the CC (today eucalyptus.internal is hardcoded) and utilized. 

As a result of this suggestion, you may want to move the bug to the BE team, but I'll leave that up to you.
It looks like VNET_DOMAINNAME already exists for this purpose, but it seems this property is not always used currently.
[~sjones], would you mind elaborating a bit? It sounds like you've tried using VNET_DOMAINNAME and it was not always effective?

[~dmitrii], quite possible I was doing something incorrectly, but is seemed the property was not used in all network modes (or perhaps my understanding of if/when/where the value would be written to the DHCP configuration file is just wrong)

Thanks, [~sjones].

According to [~nurmi], the {{VNET_DOMAINNAME}} option is supposed to work in all modes except {{SYSTEM}}, where it is not supported. The implementation is identical for {{MANAGED}} and {{MANAGED-NOVLAN}}, so it would be weird to have a discrepancy there. There may be something slightly different about {{STATIC}} that breaks it. One important thing to keep in mind is that even after changing the option and restarting the CC, instances that started before the restart will not be able to utilize the updated DNS name.

At this point, I suggest we have someone from QA re-test this in light of the new information.
[~chuck] Do we perform sanity check on this property? Why do we assume there's a leading '.' in the value?

[~spark], I saw that there's a PropertyChangeListener assigned with this one. This is how this property has always been provisioned (i.e. using a '.' upfront) and the documentation also mentions it. (I found the doc by going to the "index" section and lookup DNS and go to the second page)

=======
If you want to modify the subdomain that is reported as part of the instance DNS name, enter the following command:
{noformat}
euca-modify-property -p cloud.vmstate.instance_subdomain=.<custom-dns-subdomain>
{noformat}
When this value is modified, the public and private DNS names reported for each instance will contain the specified custom DNS subdomain name, instead of the default value, which is eucalyptus. For example, if this value is set to foobar, the instance DNS names will appear as euca-A.B.C.D.foobar.<subdomain>.

[~chuck] The fix looks good to me, with one question. What are we going to do with VNET_SUBDOMAIN? If CLC's property overrides it, do we have a way to update VNET_SUBDOMAIN so that the configuration appears consistent?
[~spark], good question. Right now it will override the CC configuration... Let me think of it

[~spark], I double checked with [~nurmi] and we need to override the domain. If the instance_subdomain is updated on the CLC, this means that all new instance will get the new domain (and the currently running instances will pick up the domain at some point during their DHCP lease time). We do not support multiple domain. The current code exert this behavior.

[~chuck] [~nurmi] Right.. and my concern is that having two parameters (property and VNET_DNS) will confuse admins. Can we just remove VNET_DNS from eucalyptus.conf? or can we update the value of it when CC receives different value from CLC?

[~spark], the goal is to deprecate the usage of VNET_DNS and VNET_SUBDOMAIN but it was decided this cannot be done in 4.0 to give time to users to adopt new methodology. This would be as early as 4.1. Essentially, today, if the CLC has a new config and the CC manual config don't match the CLC entry, the network will not work (resolving domain).

I can add some comments in the eucalyptus.conf file to indicate these 2 configuration options are being deprecated and refer to the Doc.... I can also add a log message when we detect these 2 properties have been modified. I don't think we can change flat file configuration on behalf of the operator?

[~spark], [~nurmi], what do you think?
[~chuck] ok. I think it'd be good if we comment on eucalyptus.conf.

This is now pushed into the testing branch. Testing should cover the following:

# Configuration of cloud.vmstate.instance_subdomain gets pushed to CC
# On CC restart the CC will eventually pick up the configured value from CLC
# After the property is configured a new instance is started, the DHCP configuration file should contain the proper value
# Once we have an instance running, change the property configuration should update the CC DHCP configuration file in timely manner.
# Validate that the VNET_DNS and VNET_DOMAINNAME options in eucalyptus.conf properly report indication that these will be deprecated in near future.

Fix Verified

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.0
Release     : 0.0.917.20140423gitac6b0379.el6

All conditions outlined by [~chuck] in the fix are satisfied. *NOTE* This issue remains in edge mode. A new bug is opened for that: EUCA-9204
